intro: Omphalea guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and smooth, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
